stream_context.summary: Stream focused on redesigning and polishing the Oil-Rig course, revamping early retro areas, and collaboratively inventing a new soap-vs-oil boss while touching up lighting, fog, camera, and other engine tweaks.

development_findings.summary: Kaze began a “polishing phase,” remaking older retro sections whose scale and quality no longer match later levels.
development_findings.quote: We’re gonna remake some of the old retro areas because they’re much smaller than the rest of the retro areas.

development_findings.summary: Fog was changed to blue, lighting re-tuned, and camera occlusion now ignores interior geometry, blocking only exterior walls.
development_findings.quote: If you go near a thing and it’s gonna block the camera… only outside level geometry is gonna block the camera like that.

development_findings.summary: LibUltra translation-matrix update broke the old cannon reticle; Kaze will completely rebuild the reticle to render correctly.
development_findings.quote: I kind of broke the old reticle… I’m just gonna remake that whole cannon reticle anyway because the way it’s rendered is atrocious.

development_findings.summary: Oil-Rig level layout drafted: cannon section, crane switch, wrecking-ball set-piece, Bowser office tower, underwater quick-travel corridors with Yoshi coins and retro pipe.
development_findings.quote: There’ll be a switch here and if you press the switch the crane will move and… the demolition sphere will knock off Bowser’s hat.

development_findings.summary: Decided against a full castle; Bowser’s presence is now a tall horned office tower that players can climb and view interior Easter eggs.
development_findings.quote: I think I’m gonna go with that suggestion and just have it be a big tower.

development_findings.summary: Boss concept finalised: an oil Gargantua-Blarg that emerges when a platform lowers; attacks with oil waves/bites; Mario rides a spawned soap bar to collide and shrink it until defeat.
development_findings.quote: Every now and then a soap bar spawns… if you’re on the soap bar you can chase him… once he shrinks all the way he dies.

development_findings.summary: Arena will likely be a separate barrel-style area to simplify wave collision and performance.
development_findings.quote: He eats you and spits you out in a separate area… this way the fight works and the area looks so much better.

development_findings.summary: Zeina will animate Buzzy Beetle (walk & shell) and Bowser; no other NPC animations currently needed.
development_findings.quote: Buzzy Beetles should be pretty simple… they just have a walk animation and they go into shell animation.

development_findings.summary: Magic-Show Easter egg exists only as notes; full implementation (dialogue, tricks, level segment) still pending.
development_findings.quote: The magic show is like not even started yet; I need to implement the whole thing still.

development_findings.summary: Overall project is ~⅔ complete; with full-time job, Kaze projects at least 1.5 years before release.
development_findings.quote: Realistically it’s still gonna be at least like a year and a half.

context_findings.summary: Kaze works full-time as an Unreal programmer at Gears for Breakfast, limiting mod time but funding development.
context_findings.quote: I do have a full-time job so I can’t spend that much time on it.

context_findings.summary: Plans to open-source the project only after release to avoid leaks and Nintendo issues.
context_findings.quote: I will open-source it once it is released but not before because I would just be leaking my entire mod.

context_findings.summary: He has successfully fought previous Nintendo YouTube claims and now worries less about legal threats.
context_findings.quote: Last time they took me down, I told them to fuck off… I’m not really that worried about Nintendo anymore.

context_findings.summary: Belief in disciplined work over fleeting motivation: “Just work; it’s not that hard.”
context_findings.quote: You’re physically capable of working, so why aren’t you? That’s how I approach it.

context_findings.summary: Spends personal days off working on the hack; mentions attending social events (double birthday) with Zeina, hinting at limited free time.
context_findings.quote: That’s what I do on my day off—I work.

biobak.summary: Provided design feedback on wrecking-ball texture, suggested horns on Bowser tower, and co-developed oil-Blarg/soap boss concept.
biobak.quote: You could have a little bar of soap… maybe the minions can throw you the soap bars because you’re helping them.

biobak.summary: Regularly reviews and polishes Kaze’s models for visual quality.
biobak.quote: My couch a lot with the models—he makes it a lot prettier.

zeina.summary: Handles character animations (Bowser, Buzzy Beetle) and offers to fix or create other NPC animations as needed.
zeina.quote: Are you just sticking to his idle animation or… do you want new ones? No… I can’t think of any other animations I need right now.

zeina.summary: Appears casually on stream; the couple joke about volume and personal banter, reflecting a comfortable professional/personal dynamic.
zeina.quote: If I had a girlfriend, my wife would be very disappointed—true.

key_stories.title: The Soap Solution
key_stories.summary: Faced with creating a strike-breaking boss that fit an oil-rig theme and Yoshi’s Island roots, the team invented an oil Gargantua-Blarg. Damage is dealt by surfing on spawned soap bars, shrinking the monster until it vanishes.
key_stories.challenge: Find a fresh, thematic boss that leverages Mario 64 mechanics without adding complex new controls.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed options with chat and Biobak, discarded robot pipe ideas, and iterated on arena logistics and attacks. Settled on soap-surf mechanic and a separate arena to handle oil waves.
key_stories.outcome: A clear design document: three attacks, soap spawning rules, shrink-on-hit loop, minions delivering soap, and visual cues like oil clearing when boss forms.
key_stories.key_quote: Every now and then a soap bar spawns; if you’re on the soap bar you can chase him… once he shrinks all the way he dies.

key_stories.title: From Castle to Corporate Tower
key_stories.summary: Initial plans for a mini Bowser castle were scrapped after realizing it made the level feel small and repetitive. Inspired by Biobak, Kaze replaced it with a tall horned office tower housing Bowser’s desk and visual gags.
key_stories.challenge: Standard castle felt redundant and limited space; needed a fresh visual and gameplay focal point.
key_stories.process: Discussed performance, narrative, and player sight-lines; reshaped geometry in Blender live on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Established new central prop that players can climb, peek into, and that anchors the boss-trigger platform.
key_stories.key_quote: I think I’m gonna go with that suggestion and just have it be a big tower.

key_stories.title: Retro Area Revamp
key_stories.summary: Early retro sections built years ago are now too small and dated. Kaze announced a dedicated remake phase to polish them, planning to spend his upcoming day off on it.
key_stories.challenge: Legacy content no longer matches current scope and quality.
key_stories.process: Announced decision, scheduled off-stream work, and solicited quick feedback.
key_stories.outcome: Retro revamp phase is underway, ensuring consistency across the game.
key_stories.key_quote: We’re gonna remake some of the old retro areas because they’re much smaller than the rest of the retro areas.
